intro: Hedyotis coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea, and thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are typically narrow and opposite. Hedyotis coarctata is often found in moist soils and can be a common herbaceous plant in woodland understories. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
